task.title: Configuring DNS addresses by using the
task.shortdesc: System administrators can configure the domain name server (DNS) addresses by using the Network Settings page in the .

context.p: You cannot configure DNS addresses in a virtual server environment. In other environments, you can configure DNS addresses by using the , or by using the command line. For more information about using the command line to configure DNS addresses, see .

step.cmd: Go to the Network Settings page in one of the following ways:

choices.choice: From the Home tab, click Network Settings in the Customize appliance settings pane.
From the Appliance menu, click Network Settings.

step.cmd: From the Domain Name Server Address table, choose an action:

choices.choice: To add a DNS address, click the Add icon.
To delete a DNS address, select the address and click the Delete icon.
To edit a DNS address, select the address and click the Edit icon.
To change the order of the addresses, select a DNS address and click the Arrow icons.
